activities: Scholle Corporation receives and stores human resources data for payroll, employment benefits, processing of employee work-related claims, general employment-related management activities, and compilation of a web-based internal directory.
industrysector: Plastic Materials & Resin - (PMR)Food Processing & Packaging Eqpt - (FPP)Plastics Production Machinery - (PME)
recoursemech: We anticipate resolving most issues locally, at the EU location.  Our Data Protection Policy provides that employees may direct comments or complaints to their local HR Manager.  If a complaint cannot be addressed by an employee's HR Manager, s/he will inform the employee and take the matter to the VP of HR.  Based on this discussion, the local HR Manager may then take further steps to resolve the problem, including discussing the matter with the Data Protection Compliance Office of their jurisdiction.  The organization further agrees, should a complaint be unsatisfactorily resolved via internal process, it will cooperate with the EU DPAs (Data Protection Authorities) to address unresolved complaints involving 'organization human resources data'.
